name: fatback
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
fat (= the substance under the skin) from the back of a pig, often preserved with salt: A lot of people here like chicken, cornbread and collard greens cooked with fatback. You can place thin slices of fatback over meats to protect them while roasting.
More examplesFewer examplesFatback is not as common as it used to be, because pigs are leaner nowadays.My family adds fatback to beans when they cook them.In some rural areas in the south, people's diets consisted mainly of pork fatback, molasses, and cornmeal.Use thin sheets of fatback to line the dish.This stew is flavored with stock made from chicken wings and fatback.
